name: Relative Date Criteria
title: Relative Date Criteria
description: Specifies that a date is relative to some event. The event happens [Duration] after [Event].

element.definition: Specifies that a date is relative to some event. The event happens [Duration] after [Event].
element.comment: This extension is used when a precise date is not known, but rather, the date will be relative to some future event (e.g. Do this 2 weeks after an operation).

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.short: Event that the date is relative to
element.definition: The event that the date(time) is relative to.
element.comment: This can be a reference to a particular event, or a kind of event (usually where the kind would not happen very frequently).

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.
An Extension

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](extensibility.html) for a list).

element.short: before-start | before | before-end | concurrent-with-start | concurrent | concurrent-with-end | after-start | after | after-end
element.definition: Defines the relationship between the event and the date.
Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](extensibility.html) for a list).
The duration after the event that the date(time) will happen.
